boardgame.name: Mot pour Mot
Word on the Street
boardgame.description: In Word on the Street, players _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;ndash; either individually or in teams _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;ndash; try to claim letter tiles from the game board._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;To set up the game, seventeen letter tiles (all the consonants in English other than j, q, x, and z) are placed in a strip down the center of the game board _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;ndash; the median strip of the street, if you will, which has two _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot;traffic lanes_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot; on either side of it. On a turn, one team is presented with a category such as _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot;types of fruit_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot; or _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot;something a player is wearing_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot;, and that team has thirty seconds to come up with an answer in that category, then move the letters in that word toward their side of the game board. Any letters in the word that are not on the game board are skipped. If the answer were _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot;pineapple_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot;, for example, the team would move P, N, P, P and L._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;If a team moves a letter off the game board, it has claimed that letter and that tile will not move for the remainder of the game. The first team to claim eight letter tiles wins!_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;
boardgame.boardgamehonor: 2010 Golden Geek Best Party Board Game Nominee

Game Glimpse #3: Word On The Street

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

listing.notes: Out of the Box (OBG 1792) The Hilarious Tug of Words! On each turn, one team flips over a category card. Team members frantically brainstorm words that fit the category while the opposition tries to sidetrack them. The team must agree on a word and pull each letter of that word one lane closer to their side of the street, all before the time runs out. Word on the Street will have you in the fast lane to fun!
Played once. Complete.

Out of the Box Publishing (OBG1776) Word on the Street: Party Case On each turn, one team flips over a category card. Team members frantically brainstorm words that fit the category while the opposition tries to sidetrack them. The team must agree on a word and pull each letter of that word one lane closer to their side of the street, all before the time runs out. Word on the Street will have you in the fast lane to fun. With a deluxe carrying case and two sand timers, the Party Case is perfect to take to your next gathering!
